title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-12.2 - Special definition of maximum firing rate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-12.2 - Special definition of maximum firing rate

State Regulations

For a burner which is equipped to start on low fire only
and whose firing rate cannot properly be increased beyond the low firing rate
until ignition of the low fire is proven, the term maximum firing rate used in
this Subpart means the firing rate to the largest fire that can be initially
ignited. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-12.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
